reasoning: Aggregate BOTEC estimate summing major protozoan parasitic infections: malaria (~60-100), giardiasis (~30), trichomoniasis (~40), leishmaniasis (~3), amebiasis (~7), cryptosporidiosis (~5), toxoplasmosis (~2), African trypanosomiasis (~0.5), Chagas disease (~10), and other protozoan infections (~40+) = approximately 200 per 100k globally. High heterogeneity and significant geographic variation reduce confidence.
